rtestim 0.0.1
  • Reference

    Rt estimation algorithm configuration

    configure_rt_admm.Rd

    We should convert this into an S3 method so that we can pass in a vector of counts or an rt_admm_configuration object (and overwrite)

    Usage

    configure_rt_admm(
  observed_counts,
  degree,
  weighted_past_counts = NULL,
  primal_var = NULL,
  auxi_var = NULL,
  dual_var = NULL,
  rho = -1,
  rho_adjust = -1,
  alpha = 0.5,
  gamma = 0.9,
  tolerance = 1e-04,
  maxiter_inner = 5L,
  maxiter_line = 5L,
  verbose = 0
)

    Arguments

    observed_counts

    vector of the observed daily infection counts

    degree

    Integer. Degree of the piecewise polynomial curve to be estimated. For example, `degree = 0` corresponds to a piecewise constant curve.

    weighted_past_counts

    the weighted sum of past infections counts with corresponding serial interval functions (or its Gamma approximation) as weights

    primal_var

    initial values of log(Rt)

    auxi_var

    auxiliary variable in the ADMM algorithm

    dual_var

    dual variable in the ADMM algorithm

    rho

    Double. An ADMM parameter; coefficient of augmented term in the Lagrangian function.

    rho_adjust

    Double. An ADMM parameter; adjusted coefficient of augmented term in the Lagrangian function.

    alpha

    Double. A parameter adjusting upper bound in line search algorithm in `prox_newton` algorithm.

    gamma

    Double. A parameter adjusting step size in line search algorithm in `prox_newton` algorithm.

    tolerance

    Double. Tolerance of ADMM convergence.

    maxiter_inner

    Integer. Maximum number of iterations for the inner loop of proximal Newton method.

    maxiter_line

    Integer. Maximum number of iterations for the linesearch algorithm in the proximal Newton method.

    verbose

    Integer.

    Value

    a list of model parameters with class `rt_admm_configuration`

    On this page
